prompt_init: You will receive a text. Your task is to create a new original text by taking inspiration from this text. Just output your new text, nothing else. Here is the text:
prompt_update: You will receive a text. Your task is to create a new original text by taking inspiration from this text. Just output your new text, nothing else. Here is the text:
initial_story:
The baby suffered a cardiac arrest at the theme park on Thursday

A woman has been arrested on suspicion of neglecting a five-month-old boy who suffered a cardiac arrest at a theme park.

The baby is in a critical condition in hospital following the incident at Legoland Windsor at about 13:00 BST on Thursday, police said.

A 27-year-old woman from Witham, Essex, was arrested on suspicion of neglecting a child to cause unnecessary injury.

She has been released on bail until 26 July.

Det Con Zoe Eele, of Thames Valley Police's Child Abuse Investigation Unit, said: "Firstly, our thoughts are with the family of the boy who is in a critical condition in hospital after suffering a cardiac arrest.

"We are working closely with the team at Legoland Windsor Resort but would like to speak to anyone who have information about this incident, specifically anyone who was queueing for the Coastguard HQ boat ride between around 11.30am and 12:45pm.

"I would ask for the public to please avoid speculation about the incident and to respect the boy's family at this deeply upsetting time."

Police said they are not looking for further suspects in relation to the incident.

In a statement, the theme park said: "On Thursday, a young guest was taken ill... and our fully trained First Aid team administered immediate care until the emergency services arrived.

"We will continue to support Thames Valley Police with their ongoing investigation."

Follow BBC South on Facebook, X, or Instagram. Send your story ideas to south.newsonline@bbc.co.uk or via WhatsApp on 0808 100 2240.

The BBC is not responsible for the content of external sites.
stories:
A man is being questioned by authorities following a young child's cardiac arrest at a local amusement park.

The one-year-old girl is currently in critical condition at the hospital after the incident at Funville Adventure Park on Friday afternoon.

A 34-year-old man from London was taken into custody on suspicion of child endangerment. He is currently being held for questioning and has not been charged.

Detective Sergeant Jane Simmons of the Child Protection Unit stated, "Our thoughts are with the family of the young girl who is in critical condition in the hospital after suffering a cardiac arrest. We are working closely with the staff at Funville Adventure Park but would like to speak with anyone who has information about this incident, specifically anyone who was in the vicinity of the carousel between 1:00 pm and 2:30 pm."

She added, "I would ask for the public to please avoid speculation about the incident and to respect the family's privacy during this difficult time."

The amusement park released a statement saying, "On Friday, a young guest was taken ill... and our fully trained First Aid team administered immediate care until the emergency services arrived. We will continue to support the authorities with their ongoing investigation."

The police have stated that they are not looking for any other suspects in relation to the incident.

A woman is being questioned by police after a toddler's collapse at a community fair.

The three-year-old boy is in stable but critical condition at the hospital following the incident at Happyville Family Fair on a sunny Saturday afternoon.

A 41-year-old woman from the nearby city was taken into custody on suspicion of neglect. She is being held for questioning and has not been charged.

Detective Inspector Mark Johnson of the Child Welfare Department stated, "Our hearts go out to the family of the young boy who is currently in the hospital. We are working closely with the staff at Happyville Family Fair but would like to speak with anyone who has information about this incident, specifically anyone who was near the Ferris wheel between 1:00 pm and 2:30 pm."

He added, "I would ask for the public to please avoid making assumptions about the incident and to respect the family's privacy during this challenging time."

The fair's organizers released a statement saying, "On Saturday, a young guest needed medical attention... and our dedicated First Aid team responded promptly, providing immediate care until the emergency services arrived. We will continue to cooperate fully with the authorities as they conduct their investigation."

The police have stated that they are not seeking any other individuals in relation to the incident.

A young girl is in the hospital, clinging to life, after a collapse at a local carnival. The four-year-old was quickly rushed to the hospital following the incident at the Joyful Junction Carnival on a bright, summer Sunday.

A 52-year-old woman, residing in the neighboring town, has been detained for questioning under suspicions of neglect. She has not been charged and is currently cooperating with the authorities.

Detective Sergeant Jane Wilson of the Child Protection Unit shared, "Our thoughts are with the family of the young girl during this difficult time. We are working closely with the staff at Joyful Junction Carnival, but we would like to speak with anyone who has information regarding this incident, particularly those who were near the carousel between 12:30 pm and 2:00 pm."

Wilson pleaded, "Please, let us conduct a thorough investigation before jumping to conclusions. We kindly ask for the public to respect the family's privacy as they face these challenging times."

Carnival organizers released a statement saying, "On Sunday, a young guest required medical attention... and our trained First Aid team swiftly responded, providing immediate care until the emergency services arrived. We will continue to fully cooperate with the authorities as they carry out their investigation."

The police have confirmed that there are no other individuals sought in relation to the incident.

A small boy lies in a hospital bed, fighting for his life, after an unfortunate accident at a nearby amusement park. The five-year-old was swiftly taken to the hospital following the incident at Happy Haven Amusement Park on a crisp, autumn Saturday.

A 60-year-old man, living in the nearby city, has been detained for questioning under suspicions of negligence. He has not been charged and is currently cooperating with the authorities.

Detective Sergeant Alex James of the Child Protection Unit shared, "Our hearts go out to the family of the young boy during this distressing time. We are working closely with the staff at Happy Haven Amusement Park, but we would like to speak with anyone who has information regarding this incident, particularly those who were near the ferris wheel between 1:30 pm and 3:00 pm."

James pleaded, "Please, let us conduct a comprehensive investigation before making any assumptions. We kindly ask for the public to respect the family's privacy as they navigate these challenging times."

Amusement park organizers released a statement saying, "On Saturday, a young guest required medical attention... and our trained First Aid team quickly responded, providing immediate care until the emergency services arrived. We will continue to fully cooperate with the authorities as they carry out their investigation."

The police have confirmed that there are no other individuals sought in relation to the incident.

In a children's hospital, a young girl struggles to hold onto life, the unfortunate victim of a suspected mishap at a local carnival. The seven-year-old was rushed to the medical facility shortly after an alarming incident at Joyful Junction Carnival on a bright, sunny Saturday.

A 65-year-old woman, residing in the adjacent town, has been detained to provide questioning under suspicions of carelessness. She has not been charged and is presently assisting the authorities.

Detective Sergeant Jordan Moore of the Juvenile Protection Department expressed, "Our thoughts are with the young girl's family in this difficult time. Our team is diligently working with the staff at Joyful Junction Carnival, yet we would like to connect with anyone who possesses knowledge of this event, specifically those who were in the vicinity of the carousel between 1:45 pm and 3:15 pm."

Moore appealed, "We ask for the public's cooperation to allow us to carry out a thorough investigation before drawing any conclusions. We urge everyone to respect the family's privacy as they face these challenging circumstances."

Carnival coordinators released a statement declaring, "On Saturday, a young visitor required medical assistance... and our dedicated First Aid team promptly responded, delivering immediate care until the emergency services arrived. We remain committed to fully cooperating with the authorities throughout their investigation."

The police have verified that there are no additional individuals being sought in relation to the incident.
